issue.title: FATAL:render_process_host_impl.cc(819) Check failed: map_.empty().

labels.name: bug/regression :leftwards_arrow_with_hook:
labels.description: A new version of Electron broke something

labels.name: status/confirmed
labels.description: A maintainer reproduced the bug or agreed with the feature

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
Crash encountered by running the test case in 
https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/12506 on electron 2-0-x (last commit: d432038aab0f990672b2be769b531cf09b20be0a on April 9) on Ubuntu 18.04 on an x86_64 box.

body: @kwonoj did you verify this to work in `1-8-x`? The api file for `contentTracing` is identical between the `1-8-x` and `2-0-x` release line branches so i'm not sure it's a regression; if `1-8-x` does indeed work than it may be an upstream issue in chromium
@codebytere issue body attaches comparison between latest 1.8 and 2.0. With attached code snippet it can be reproduced easily.

I have been investigating the memory tracing. I think it is likely memory tracing was broken by this chromium change -> https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!msg/tracing/cLKj2Nb9SaA/x_vh_F1OBgAJ
If a memory_dump_config is not set in tracing then memory dumps won't occur periodically. This would mean no tracing for memory. Electron does not allow memory_dump_config to be specified currently.
Maybe a fix would allow this to be set in tracing config.

issue.title: fix: extend tracing startRecording API to take a full tracing config

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
This allows memory-infra to be traced correctly. For memory-infra to be traced memory_dump_config and triggers need to be defined.
Fixes #12506.

Example usage:
```js
const options = {
  "record_mode": "record-until-full",
  "enable_systrace": true,
  "enable_argument_filter": false,
  "excluded_categories": ["*"],
  "included_categories": ["disabled-by-default-memory-infra"],
  "memory_dump_config": {allowed_dump_modes: ["background", "light", "detailed"],
  "triggers": [{min_time_between_dumps_ms: 1000,  "mode": "detailed", "type": "periodic_interval"}]},
}

contentTracing.startRecording(options, () => { })
```
More? docs https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/memory-infra/memory_infra_startup_tracing.md#the-advanced-way

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd
- [x] `npm test` passes
- [x] tests are [changed or added](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/development/testing.md)
- [ ] relevant documentation is changed or added
- [x] PR title follows semantic [commit guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/development/pull-requests.md#commit-message-guidelines)

#### Release Notes
<!-- Used to describe release notes for future release versions. Use `no-notes` to indicate no user-facing changes. -->

Notes: allow passing a trace config as options to a "contentTracing.startRecording" call

body: I have a [PR](https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/13914) for fixing the tracing of memory-infra by passing a full tracing config. Still a WIP but I am interested in feedback.
